intro: Piper bogotense, commonly known as the Bogotá pepper, is a tropical vine native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Piperaceae family, which includes other pepper plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered greenish-white flowers. Its fruits are peppery and used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests.
